"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54e6c05b6368720ba97e0800#post_54e6c05b6368720ba97e0800
I like Jack too. He's funny when he's mad.
And to think, without Markiplier I never would've found him.

Also, got another question for you. Pretty soon, I'll be able to scrounge up enough money for another 3DS game (or maybe several). As before, I'm debating whether to get Bravely Default, Kid Icarus Uprising, or Fire Emblem Awakening. Which of those if any would you recommend?

topics.body:
"@Silent_Witness":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54e6c25963687277e8211500#post_54e6c25963687277e8211500
Hmmmmmm.
Kid Icarus is pretty awesome but the controls take some getting used too.
Bravely Default is the best Final Fantasy game in the past ten years.
I never finished Fire Emblem but I've heard good things.
I'd say Kid Icarus for it's INSANE replay value.

Remember Bad Boys 2? The scene where Will Smith and Martin Laurence popped out of the Klan robes with their guns out. That scene is probably the best use of a slow-mo camera spin I have ever seen.

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54e6d209636872299dfe1800#post_54e6d209636872299dfe1800
My theory is that the reason his movies are generally so unbearable is because deep down he _hates_ his audience. As evidence I present Pain and Gain, the only Michael Bay movie I actually like which is really, really misanthropic.

Pain and Gain may have been really fucking stupid, but it was kind of brilliant in it's stupidity.
